message.content: This question requires knowledge about the weather patterns and seasons in the northern hemisphere. In December, which is during winter in the northern hemisphere, the weather is cold. Therefore, you would need mittens to keep your hands warm. Options (A), (B), and (C) are not suitable for the cold weather. Short shorts are more appropriate for warm weather, cooling fans are used to stay cool in hot weather, and suntan lotion is used to protect the skin from the sun, which is less intense during winter.

This question requires knowledge about the weather patterns in the northern hemisphere during December. In the northern hemisphere, December is winter season. During this time, the temperatures are generally cold, so you would need to wear warm clothing such as mittens to keep your hands warm. Option (A) is incorrect because short shorts would not provide enough warmth in cold weather. Option (B) is unnecessary because cooling fans are used to cool down in hot weather. Option (C) is unnecessary because you won't need suntan lotion during the winter months when the sun is not as strong.
